qas.question: What is the term for recycled parchments used in ancient manuscripts?
Before which year were the Sana'a manuscripts produced?
In which city was evidence of pre-Uthmanic Quranic writing discovered in 1972?
What version of the Quran was the scriptio superior of the Sana'a manuscripts?
What is the term for recycled parchments unused in ancient manuscripts?
What is the term for recycled parchments used in modern manuscripts?
After which year were the Sana'a manuscripts produced?
In which city was evidence of pre-Uthmanic Quranic writing discovered in 1927?
What version of the Quran was the scriptio inferior of the Sana'a manuscripts?

context: In 1972, in a mosque in the city of <a2_0><b7_0>Sana'a, Yemen<b7_0/><a2_0/>, manuscripts were discovered that were later proved to be the most ancient Quranic text known to exist at the time. The Sana'a manuscripts contain <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>palimpsests<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, a manuscript page from which the text has been washed off to make the parchment reusable again—a practice which was common in ancient times due to scarcity of writing material. However, the faint washed-off underlying text (scriptio inferior) is still barely visible and believed to be "pre-Uthmanic" Quranic content, while the text written on top (scriptio superior) is believed to belong to <a3_0><b8_0>Uthmanic<b8_0/><a3_0/> time. Studies using radiocarbon dating indicate that the parchments are dated to the period before <a1_0><b6_0>671 AD<b6_0/><a1_0/> with a 99 percent probability.
